text: I used to hike up Granite Peak in the Cascades, maybe 6 times in the 90s and 00s.  That’s about 4 miles in, 3800 feet up, to reach a fire lookout tower much like the one in the article.  One memorable time, I got passed by a lookout staffer muscling up the mountain with a propane tank strapped to his already heavy pack.  By the time I caught up with him at the top, the tank had been put to good use, baking a batch of chocolate chip cookies.  He shared :-)
You play as a fire lookout in the "walking simulator" Firewatch (https://www.firewatchgame.com/)

NPR ran a similar story two weeks ago:

A Fire Lookout On What's Lost In A Transition To Technology

https://www.npr.org/2019/09/15/749547034/a-fire-lookout-on-w...
Something I fantasized about after reading Dharma Bums by Kerouac in college.
